trans-unit.source: My first textual runbook in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: My first textual runbook in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tutorial that walks you through the creation, testing, and publishing of a simple textual runbook using PowerShell Workflow.
trans-unit.target: Tutorial that walks you through the creation, testing, and publishing of a simple textual runbook using PowerShell Workflow.

trans-unit.source: Several concepts are covered such as authenticating to Azure resources and input parameters.
trans-unit.target: Several concepts are covered such as authenticating to Azure resources and input parameters.

trans-unit.source: My first textual runbook
trans-unit.target: My first textual runbook

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Graphical
trans-unit.target: Graphical

trans-unit.source: Textual
trans-unit.target: Textual

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the creation of a [textual runbook](automation-powershell-workflow.md) in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the creation of a [textual runbook](automation-powershell-workflow.md) in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: We'll start with a simple runbook that we'll test and publish while we explain how to track the status of the runbook job.
trans-unit.target: We'll start with a simple runbook that we'll test and publish while we explain how to track the status of the runbook job.

trans-unit.source: Then we'll modify the runbook to actually manage Azure resources, in this case starting an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Then we'll modify the runbook to actually manage Azure resources, in this case starting an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: We'll then make the runbook more robust by adding runbook parameters.
trans-unit.target: We'll then make the runbook more robust by adding runbook parameters.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you will need the following.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you will need the following.

trans-unit.source: Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one yet, you can [activate your MSDN subscriber benefits](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) or <a href="/pricing/free-trial/" target="_blank">[sign up for a free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one yet, you can [activate your MSDN subscriber benefits](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) or <a href="/pricing/free-trial/" target="_blank">[sign up for a free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: [Automation account](automation-configuring.md) to hold the runbook.
trans-unit.target: [Automation account](automation-configuring.md) to hold the runbook.

trans-unit.source: An Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: An Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: We will stop and start this machine so it should not be production.
trans-unit.target: We will stop and start this machine so it should not be production.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Active Directory user and Automation Credential asset](automation-configuring.md) to authenticate to Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Active Directory user and Automation Credential asset](automation-configuring.md) to authenticate to Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: This user must have permission to start and stop the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This user must have permission to start and stop the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Create new runbook
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Create new runbook

trans-unit.source: We'll start by creating a simple runbook that outputs the text *Hello World*.
trans-unit.target: We'll start by creating a simple runbook that outputs the text *Hello World*.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview Portal, open your Automation account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview Portal, open your Automation account.

trans-unit.source: The Automation account page gives you a quick view of the resources in this account.
trans-unit.target: The Automation account page gives you a quick view of the resources in this account.

trans-unit.source: You should already have some Assets.
trans-unit.target: You should already have some Assets.

trans-unit.source: Most of those are the modules that are automatically included in a new Automation account.
trans-unit.target: Most of those are the modules that are automatically included in a new Automation account.

trans-unit.source: You should also have the Credential asset that's mentioned in the [prerequisites](#prerequisites).
trans-unit.target: You should also have the Credential asset that's mentioned in the [prerequisites](#prerequisites).

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Runbooks** tile to open the list of runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Runbooks** tile to open the list of runbooks.

trans-unit.source: ![Runbooks control](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbooks-control.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runbooks control](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbooks-control.png)

trans-unit.source: Create a new runbook by clicking on the **Add a runbook** button and then **Create a new runbook**.
trans-unit.target: Create a new runbook by clicking on the **Add a runbook** button and then **Create a new runbook**.

trans-unit.source: Give the runbook the name *MyFirstRunbook-Textual*.
trans-unit.target: Give the runbook the name *MyFirstRunbook-Textual*.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we're going to create a [textual runbook](automation-powershell-workflow.md) based on PowerShell Workflow so select **Powershell Workflow** for **Runbook type**.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we're going to create a [textual runbook](automation-powershell-workflow.md) based on PowerShell Workflow so select **Powershell Workflow** for **Runbook type**.

trans-unit.source: ![New runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/new-runbook.png)
trans-unit.target: ![New runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/new-runbook.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** to create the runbook and open the textual editor.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** to create the runbook and open the textual editor.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add code to the runbook
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add code to the runbook

trans-unit.source: You can either type code directly into the runbook, or you can select cmdlets, runbooks, and assets from the Library control and have them added to the runbook with any related parameters.
trans-unit.target: You can either type code directly into the runbook, or you can select cmdlets, runbooks, and assets from the Library control and have them added to the runbook with any related parameters.

trans-unit.source: For this walkthrough, we'll type directly into the runbook.
trans-unit.target: For this walkthrough, we'll type directly into the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Our runbook is currently empty with only the required *workflow* keyword, the name of our runbook, and the braces that will encase the entire workflow.
trans-unit.target: Our runbook is currently empty with only the required *workflow* keyword, the name of our runbook, and the braces that will encase the entire workflow.

trans-unit.source: ![Runbooks control](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/empty-runbook.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runbooks control](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/empty-runbook.png)

trans-unit.source: Type *Write-Output "Hello World."* between the braces.
trans-unit.target: Type *Write-Output "Hello World."* between the braces.

trans-unit.source: ![Hello world](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/hello-world.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Hello world](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/hello-world.png)

trans-unit.source: Save the runbook by clicking **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Save the runbook by clicking **Save**.

trans-unit.source: ![Save runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-save.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Save runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-save.png)

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Test the runbook
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Test the runbook

trans-unit.source: Before we publish the runbook to make it available in production, we want to test it to make sure that it works properly.
trans-unit.target: Before we publish the runbook to make it available in production, we want to test it to make sure that it works properly.

trans-unit.source: When you test a runbook, you run its **Draft** version and view its output interactively.
trans-unit.target: When you test a runbook, you run its **Draft** version and view its output interactively.

trans-unit.source: Click **Test pane** to open the Test pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test pane** to open the Test pane.

trans-unit.source: ![Test pane](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-test-pane.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Test pane](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-test-pane.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Start** to start the test.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start** to start the test.

trans-unit.source: This should be the only enabled option.
trans-unit.target: This should be the only enabled option.

trans-unit.source: A [runbook job](automation-runbook-execution) is created and its status displayed.
trans-unit.target: A [runbook job](automation-runbook-execution) is created and its status displayed.

trans-unit.source: The job status will start as *Queued* indicating that it is waiting for a runbook worker in the cloud to come available.
trans-unit.target: The job status will start as *Queued* indicating that it is waiting for a runbook worker in the cloud to come available.

trans-unit.source: It will then move to *Starting* when a worker claims the job, and then *Running* when the runbook actually starts running.
trans-unit.target: It will then move to *Starting* when a worker claims the job, and then *Running* when the runbook actually starts running.

trans-unit.source: When the runbook job completes, its output is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When the runbook job completes, its output is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In our case, we should see *Hello World*.
trans-unit.target: In our case, we should see *Hello World*.

trans-unit.source: ![Hello World](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/test-output-hello-world.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Hello World](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/test-output-hello-world.png)

trans-unit.source: Close the Test pane to return to the canvas.
trans-unit.target: Close the Test pane to return to the canvas.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 - Publish and start the runbook
trans-unit.target: Step 4 - Publish and start the runbook

trans-unit.source: The runbook that we just created is still in Draft mode.
trans-unit.target: The runbook that we just created is still in Draft mode.

trans-unit.source: We need to publish it before we can run it in production.
trans-unit.target: We need to publish it before we can run it in production.

trans-unit.source: When you publish a runbook, you overwrite the existing Published version with the Draft version.
trans-unit.target: When you publish a runbook, you overwrite the existing Published version with the Draft version.

trans-unit.source: In our case, we don't have a Published version yet because we just created the runbook.
trans-unit.target: In our case, we don't have a Published version yet because we just created the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish** to publish the runbook and then **Yes** when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish** to publish the runbook and then **Yes** when prompted.

trans-unit.source: ![Publish](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-publish.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Publish](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-edit-toolbar-publish.png)

trans-unit.source: If you scroll left to view the runbook in the **Runbooks** pane now, it will show an **Authoring Status** of **Published**.
trans-unit.target: If you scroll left to view the runbook in the **Runbooks** pane now, it will show an **Authoring Status** of **Published**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll back to the right to view the pane for **MyFirstRunbook-Textual**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll back to the right to view the pane for **MyFirstRunbook-Textual**.

trans-unit.source: The options across the top allow us to start the runbook, schedule it to start at some time in the future, or create a [webhook](automation-webhooks.md) so it can be started through an HTTP call.
trans-unit.target: The options across the top allow us to start the runbook, schedule it to start at some time in the future, or create a [webhook](automation-webhooks.md) so it can be started through an HTTP call.

trans-unit.source: We just want to start the runbook so click **Start** and then **Yes** when prompted.
trans-unit.target: We just want to start the runbook so click **Start** and then **Yes** when prompted.

trans-unit.source: ![Start runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-toolbar-start.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Start runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-toolbar-start.png)

trans-unit.source: A job pane is opened for the runbook job that we just created.
trans-unit.target: A job pane is opened for the runbook job that we just created.

trans-unit.source: We can close this pane, but in this case we'll leave it open so we can watch the job's progress.
trans-unit.target: We can close this pane, but in this case we'll leave it open so we can watch the job's progress.

trans-unit.source: The job status is shown in **Job Summary** and matches the statuses that we saw when we tested the runbook.
trans-unit.target: The job status is shown in **Job Summary** and matches the statuses that we saw when we tested the runbook.

trans-unit.source: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-summary.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-summary.png)

trans-unit.source: Once the runbook status shows *Completed*, click **Output**.
trans-unit.target: Once the runbook status shows *Completed*, click **Output**.

trans-unit.source: The **Output** pane is opened, and we can see our *Hello World*.
trans-unit.target: The **Output** pane is opened, and we can see our *Hello World*.

trans-unit.source: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-output.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-output.png)

trans-unit.source: Close the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: Close the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: Click **Streams** to open the Streams pane for the runbook job.
trans-unit.target: Click **Streams** to open the Streams pane for the runbook job.

trans-unit.source: We should only see *Hello World* in the output stream, but this can show other streams for a runbook job such as Verbose and Error if the runbook writes to them.
trans-unit.target: We should only see *Hello World* in the output stream, but this can show other streams for a runbook job such as Verbose and Error if the runbook writes to them.

trans-unit.source: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-streams.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Job Summary](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/job-pane-streams.png)

trans-unit.source: Close the Streams pane and the Job pane to return to the MyFirstRunbook pane.
trans-unit.target: Close the Streams pane and the Job pane to return to the MyFirstRunbook pane.

trans-unit.source: Click **Jobs** to open the Jobs pane for this runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click **Jobs** to open the Jobs pane for this runbook.

trans-unit.source: This lists all of the jobs created by this runbook.
trans-unit.target: This lists all of the jobs created by this runbook.

trans-unit.source: We should only see one job listed since we only ran the job once.
trans-unit.target: We should only see one job listed since we only ran the job once.

trans-unit.source: ![Jobs](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-control-jobs.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Jobs](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-control-jobs.png)

trans-unit.source: You can click on this job to open the same Job pane that we viewed when we started the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can click on this job to open the same Job pane that we viewed when we started the runbook.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to go back in time and view the details of any job that was created for a particular runbook.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to go back in time and view the details of any job that was created for a particular runbook.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 - Add authentication to manage Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Step 5 - Add authentication to manage Azure resources

trans-unit.source: We've tested and published our runbook, but so far it doesn't do anything useful.
trans-unit.target: We've tested and published our runbook, but so far it doesn't do anything useful.

trans-unit.source: We want to have it manage Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: We want to have it manage Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: It won't be able to do that though unless we have it authenticate using the credentials that are referred to in the [prerequisites](#prerequisites).
trans-unit.target: It won't be able to do that though unless we have it authenticate using the credentials that are referred to in the [prerequisites](#prerequisites).

trans-unit.source: We do that with the **Add-AzureAccount** cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: We do that with the **Add-AzureAccount** cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Open the textual editor by clicking **Edit** on the MyFirstRunbook-Textual pane.
trans-unit.target: Open the textual editor by clicking **Edit** on the MyFirstRunbook-Textual pane.

trans-unit.source: ![Edit runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-toolbar-edit.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Edit runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/runbook-toolbar-edit.png)

trans-unit.source: We don't need the **Write-Output** line anymore, so go ahead and delete it.
trans-unit.target: We don't need the **Write-Output** line anymore, so go ahead and delete it.

trans-unit.source: Position the cursor on a blank line between the braces.
trans-unit.target: Position the cursor on a blank line between the braces.

trans-unit.source: In the Library control, expand **Assets** and then **Credentials**.
trans-unit.target: In the Library control, expand **Assets** and then **Credentials**.

trans-unit.source: Right click your credential and click **Add to canvas**.
trans-unit.target: Right click your credential and click **Add to canvas**.

trans-unit.source: This adds a **Get-AutomationPSCredential** activity for your credential.
trans-unit.target: This adds a **Get-AutomationPSCredential** activity for your credential.

trans-unit.source: In front of **Get-AutomationPSCredential**, type *$Credential =* to assign the credential to a variable.
trans-unit.target: In front of **Get-AutomationPSCredential**, type *$Credential =* to assign the credential to a variable.

trans-unit.source: On the next line, type *Add-AzureAccount -Credential $Credential*.
trans-unit.target: On the next line, type *Add-AzureAccount -Credential $Credential*.

trans-unit.source: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/authentication.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/authentication.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Test pane** so that we can test the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test pane** so that we can test the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Click **Start** to start the test.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start** to start the test.

trans-unit.source: Once it completes, you should receive output similar to the following that returns the information for the user in the credential.
trans-unit.target: Once it completes, you should receive output similar to the following that returns the information for the user in the credential.

trans-unit.source: This confirms that the credential is valid.
trans-unit.target: This confirms that the credential is valid.

trans-unit.source: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/authentication-test.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/authentication-test.png)

trans-unit.source: Step 6 - Add code to start a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Step 6 - Add code to start a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Now that our runbook is authenticating to our Azure subscription, we can manage resources.
trans-unit.target: Now that our runbook is authenticating to our Azure subscription, we can manage resources.

trans-unit.source: We'll add a command to start a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: We'll add a command to start a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can pick any virtual machine in your Azure subscription, and for now we'll be hardcoding that name into the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can pick any virtual machine in your Azure subscription, and for now we'll be hardcoding that name into the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: After *Add-AzureAccount*, type *Start-AzureVM -Name 'VMName' -ServiceName 'VMServiceName'* providing the name and service name of the virtual machine to start.
trans-unit.target: After *Add-AzureAccount*, type *Start-AzureVM -Name 'VMName' -ServiceName 'VMServiceName'* providing the name and service name of the virtual machine to start.

trans-unit.source: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/start-azurevm.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/start-azurevm.png)

trans-unit.source: Save the runbook and then click **Test pane** so that we can test it.
trans-unit.target: Save the runbook and then click **Test pane** so that we can test it.

trans-unit.source: Click **Start** to start the test.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start** to start the test.

trans-unit.source: Once it completes, check that the virtual machine was started.
trans-unit.target: Once it completes, check that the virtual machine was started.

trans-unit.source: Step 7 - Add an input parameter to the runbook
trans-unit.target: Step 7 - Add an input parameter to the runbook

trans-unit.source: Our runbook currently starts the virtual machine that we hardcoded in the runbook, but it would be more useful if we could specify the virtual machine when the runbook is started.
trans-unit.target: Our runbook currently starts the virtual machine that we hardcoded in the runbook, but it would be more useful if we could specify the virtual machine when the runbook is started.

trans-unit.source: We will now add input parameters to the runbook to provide that functionality.
trans-unit.target: We will now add input parameters to the runbook to provide that functionality.

trans-unit.source: Add parameters for *VMName* and *VMServiceName* to the runbook and use these variables with the **Start-AzureVM** cmdlet as in the following image.
trans-unit.target: Add parameters for *VMName* and *VMServiceName* to the runbook and use these variables with the **Start-AzureVM** cmdlet as in the following image.

trans-unit.source: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/params.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Authenticate](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/params.png)

trans-unit.source: Save the runbook and open the Test pane.
trans-unit.target: Save the runbook and open the Test pane.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can now provide values for the two input variables that will be used in the test.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can now provide values for the two input variables that will be used in the test.

trans-unit.source: Close the Test pane.
trans-unit.target: Close the Test pane.

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish** to publish the new version of the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish** to publish the new version of the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Stop the virtual machine that you started in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Stop the virtual machine that you started in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Click **Start** to start the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start** to start the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Type in the **VMName** and **VMServiceName** for the virtual machine that you're going to start.
trans-unit.target: Type in the **VMName** and **VMServiceName** for the virtual machine that you're going to start.

trans-unit.source: ![Start Runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/start-runbook-input-params.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Start Runbook](media/automation-first-runbook-textual/start-runbook-input-params.png)

trans-unit.source: When the runbook completes, check that the virtual machine was started.
trans-unit.target: When the runbook completes, check that the virtual machine was started.

trans-unit.source: Related articles
trans-unit.target: Related articles

trans-unit.source: [My first graphical runbook](automation-first-runbook-graphical.md)
trans-unit.target: [My first graphical runbook](automation-first-runbook-graphical.md)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
